pycypher.node_classes

Node Classes

The AST that is generated by the parser has nodes taken from this module.

Classes

Alias(reference, alias)

A node representing use of an AS statement in the query.

And(left_side, right_side)

BinaryBoolean(left_side, operator, right_side)

Cypher(cypher)

The root node of the AST.

Equals(left_side, operator, right_side)

Binary infix operator for equality.

GreaterThan(left_side, operator, right_side)

Binary infix operator for greater than.

LessThan(left_side, operator, right_side)

Binary infix operator for less than.

Literal(value)

Mapping(key, value)

MappingSet(mappings)

Match(pattern[, where])

The node that represents the MATCH clause of the query.

MatchList(match_list)

Node(node_name_label[, mapping_list])

NodeNameLabel(name[, label])

ObjectAttributeLookup(object, attribute)

A node that represents the value of an attribut of a node or relationship of the form node.attribute.

Or(left_side, operator, right_side)

Predicate(left_side, operator, right_side)

A node of the AST that represents a unary or binary expression with a definite truth value.

Projection([lookups])

Query(match_clause, return_clause)

The node that represents the entire query.

Relationship(name)

RelationshipChain(steps)

RelationshipChainList(relationships)

RelationshipLeftRight(relationship)

RelationshipRightLeft(relationship)

Return(node)

Where(predicate)
